title: Imagining Seeing Cats Symptom of Schizophrenia

content.question: Jimmy, who was diagnosed with schizophrenia, sees images of cats everywhere even when no cats are present. What symptom is Jimmy most clearly demonstrating?

choices.label: Paranoia, because Jimmy thinks the cats are out to attack him.
Disorganized thinking, because seeing imaginary cats all over the place is a sign of disorganization.
Hallucinations, because Jimmy’s perception is incorrect.
Delusions, because Jimmy thinks that he is a cat.

content.answer: Hallucinations, because Jimmy’s perception is incorrect.

topic.text: 5.4: Selection of Categories of Psychological Disorders

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
